Detailed Description

A Component is a graphical object restricted by a bounding rectangle, which can be modified in position and size in different manners. Every component a pointer to a view. The view defines the look of the component and changes dynamically, when the theme has been changed. Every component might have a model, which is useful for complex components which share behaviour but need different implementations for getting and setting data.

Member Function Documentation

void Component::AdjustParent (  Control *  parent  )  [inline]
 

Sets the parent-property to parent, without detaching the component from the old parent or attaching it to the new parent. It is recommended to use the method Control::SetParent in applications, but for special usecases where e. g. one instance of a component is a child of several parents, this method might be useful.

void Component::Cleanup (   )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked, when the component gets invisible e. g. when the parent-window which contains the component is closed.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, SvgPlayer, Menu, AbstractEditor, AbstractItemGrid, AnimatedTextLine, ContextMenu, Control, ImageBox, ItemBox, ItemMenu, and ItemTree.

Model * Component::CreateModel (   )  const [protected, virtual]
 

Factory method for creating a model. Must be implemented by every class, which needs it's own model. By default a component has no model and 0 is returned. If a model is dynamically created by 'new', it must be deleted in the destructor by e. g. delete GetModel();.

Returns:
Pointer to the model.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, Animation, CheckBox, CheckBoxList, DateEditBox, EditBox, Grid, MenuList, ProviderListBox, RadioButtonList, TextList, TimeEditBox, DateEditor, IpAddrEditor, LineEditor, MultiLineEditor, PasswordEditor, TimeEditor, and EmsEditor.

void Component::DeleteLater (   ) 
 

Performs a deferred deletion of the component. The deletion will be done in the next idle state of the scheduler. Invoking this method is recommended e. g. if a window is created dynamically and should be deleted when closing the window. By overwriting Window::OnClose and invoking DeleteLater this can be done in a safe way (invoking 'delete this' inside Window::OnClose is not allowed!).

const Rect& Component::GetBoundingRect (   )  const [inline]

Bounding rectangle.

XYDIM Component::GetDefaultHeight (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
Default height of the object. If no default height has been specified, -1 is returned. Usually the default height is defined by the view object of the component.

Reimplemented in SvgPlayer, SelectionBox, StrokeBox, T9PinyinBox, Zi8AlphabetBox, Zi8SelectionBox, Zi8StrokeBox, Animation, ImageBox, ItemBox, LineEditor, and Window.

Returns:
Default width of the object. If no default width has been specified, -1 is returned. Usually the default width is defined by the view object of the component.

Reimplemented in SvgPlayer, Animation, ImageBox, ItemBox, and Window.

Height of the bounding rectangle.

Reimplemented in SvgPlayer.

INT Component::GetId (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns the unique ID available for each instance which has been generated by Aragon. Per default -1 is returned, which means that the instance has not been generated by Aragon. Don't mix the the unique ID with the RTTI provided by Component::IsInstanceOf.

Model * Component::GetModel (   )  const
 

Returns:
Pointer to the corresponding model.

Control* Component::GetParent (   )  const [inline]
 

Returns:
Pointer to the parent control. If the control is a root-control, 0 is returned. It is assured, that a root-control is an instance of the class Window.

BOOLEAN Component::IsInstanceOf (  INT  id  )  const [virtual]
 

Returns TRUE, if the component is an instance of the component-class with the ID id. Must be implemented by each derived class the following way: 

BOOLEAN MyComponent::IsInstanceOf(INT id) const
{
    if (ID != id)
        return Base::IsInstanceOf(id);
    return TRUE;
}

Example: if it should be checked, whether an item is an instance of the class Window the following code might be used: 

if (comp->IsInstanceOf(Window::ID)) {
    Window* win = (Window*)win;
    ...
}

The following ID ranges are reserved:

  • 0 to 999: APOXI
  • 1000 to 1999: Reference MMI and Applications
  • 2000 to 49999: Customer Projects
  • 50000 to 65535: 3rd Pary Applications (see GuiIDs.pdf for details)

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AtlWindow, AtlItemGridWindow, AtlItemListWindow, AtlItemMenuWindow, AbstractButton, AbstractEditor, AbstractGrid, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, AbstractTextObject, Alert, AnimatedTextLine, CheckBoxControl, ContextMenu, Control, DateEditor, DrawableObject, FlowLayout, GridLayout, ImageBox, IpAddrEditor, ItemBox, ItemGrid, ItemMenu, ItemTree, LineEditor, MessageBox, MultiLineEditor, Panel, PasswordEditor, PositionIndicator, ProgressBar, PushButton, RadioButtonControl, TabButton, TabControl, TextBox, TextLine, TimeEditor, and Window.

virtual void Component::OnLanguageChanged (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Is called, after the language has been changed. Overwrite this method when the component contains strings which should get retranslated. Don't forget to invoke the base method.

Implemented in AtlWindow, CheckBox, CheckBoxList, Menu, MenuList, RadioButtonList, SoftkeyBar, AbstractButton, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractTextObject, Control, DrawableObject, TabControl, and Window.

virtual void Component::OnThemeChanged (   )  [protected, pure virtual]
 

Is called, after the theme has been changed. Overwrite this method if the component has a theme dependant view. Don't forget to invoke the base method.

Implemented in AtlWindow, AbstractEditBox, AbstractListBox, Animation, CheckBox, CheckBoxList, Grid, MenuList, RadioButtonList, SoftkeyBar, TextList, AbstractGrid, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractTextObject, CheckBoxControl, Control, DrawableObject, FlowLayout, GridLayout, MultiLineEditor, Panel, PositionIndicator, ProgressBar, PushButton, RadioButtonControl, TabButton, TabControl, and Window.

void Component::Refresh (  const Rect &  rect  )  [protected, virtual]
 

Is invoked, before the component gets visible e. g. when the parent-window which contains the component is opened.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AtlItemBox, AbstractEditBox, AbstractListBox, CheckBox, CheckBoxList, Grid, Menu, MenuList, RadioButtonList, TextList, AbstractEditor, AbstractGrid, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractMultiLineEditor, AnimatedTextLine, CheckBoxControl, ContextMenu, Control, DateEditor, ImageBox, ItemBox, ItemMenu, ItemTree, PushButton, RadioButtonControl, TabButton, TabControl, and Window.

void Component::SetId (  INT  id  )  [inline]
 

Sets the unique ID (used by Aragon).

void Component::SetModel (  Model *  model  )  [inline, protected]
 

Changes the model during runtime. If a model has been created dynamically inside Component::CreateModel it must be deleted before invoking Component::SetModel. Generally it is recommended to change the content of the model instead of changing the model itself.

See also:
CreateModel

virtual void Component::SetParent (  Control *  parent  )  [pure virtual]
 

Embeds the component as part of the Control parent and removes it from the current parent.

Implemented in Control, and DrawableObject.

BOOLEAN Component::SetProperty (  ResourceParser &  parser,
const GuiObjectFactory::PropertyId  prop_id
) 
 

Initializes the instance by reading out a resource file generated by ARAGON. This method may not be invoked by the MMI in a direct manner and might be changed in future releases.

Reimplemented in MultiMediaEditor, AtlWindow, AbstractButton, AbstractEditor, AbstractGrid, AbstractItemGrid, AbstractLineEditor, AbstractMultiLineEditor, AbstractTextObject, Alert, AnimatedTextLine, CheckBoxControl, ContextMenu, Control, DateEditor, DrawableObject, FlowLayout, GridLayout, ImageBox, IpAddrEditor, ItemBox, ItemGrid, ItemMenu, ItemTree, LineEditor, MessageBox, MultiLineEditor, PasswordEditor, PositionIndicator, ProgressBar, PushButton, RadioButtonControl, TabButton, TabControl, TextBox, TextLine, TimeEditor, and Window.

void Component::SetView (  const View *  view  )  [inline, protected]
 

Sets the view for the component. Usually this is done once when the component is constructed and each time the theme has been changed (see Component::OnLanguageChanged).

Field Documentation

const View* Component::m_abstract_view [protected]
 

m_abstract_view is protected and not private for backward-compatibility with older APOXI-versions. It is strongly recommended to use Component::SetView() and Component::GetView() instead of direct accessing to m_abstract_view.
